Track your Cycle

Groove uses advanced algorithms to predict your period with incredible accuracy. The more you use Groove, and the more data you add, the smarter it will become.

Enter data about your unique cycle – bleeding, cervical fluid patterns, sexual behavior – and view it all on a stunning, one-of-a-kind chart. Groove is the period app you've been waiting for.

Groove is the period app you've been waiting for – a beautifully simple app for a beautifully unique you.

Know when you're fertile.

It's a little-known fact that women aren't fertile every day of the menstrual cycle. Groove's advanced features help you practice Fertility Awareness to confidently and naturally avoid a pregnancy, get pregnant quickly, or keep track of your reproductive health.

Enter data about two simple fertility signs – basal body temperature and cervical fluid – to practice Fertility Awareness. Your body can do amazing things, and Groove can help.

Learn the method for free

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Groove's Fertility Charting account?

Groove’s advanced Fertility Charting account has all the amazing features you need to practice the sympto-thermal method. The sympto-thermal method is an incredible way to take control of your reproductive health, and it requires the daily charting of two simple fertility signs: (1) basal body temperature and (2) cervical fluid. The sympto-thermal method can be used as a form of natural and effective birth control, as a tool to help you get pregnant quickly, or as a tool to monitor your reproductive health! Learn how to practice the sympto-thermal method for free.

What exactly is cervical fluid and how do I check it?

Each cycle, your cervix produces fluid. This fluid is a perfectly natural and healthy bodily secretion! Monitoring cervical fluid allows you to pinpoint the beginning of the fertile window, and it’s an excellent way to make sure your reproductive system is functioning normally. Learning how to check your cervical fluid is both simple and incredibly useful. Read more about cervical fluid on our website or get in touch with a Fertility Awareness Educator.

What’s basal body temperature and why should I track it?

Basal body temperature (BBT) is your body’s core temperature at rest, and it should be measured first thing when you wake up in the morning. After ovulation occurs, your body produces a hormone called progesterone that causes a sustained rise in your BBT. Tracking your BBT helps confirm ovulation and the end of your fertile window. Learn more about basal body temperature.

Help...I don't understand fertility charting!

Don’t worry, we’ve all been there...that’s why we’re here to guide and support you! You can learn the basics of charting your fertility using the sympto-thermal method for free right from our website. If you're still not totally confident in your ability to practice the sympto-thermal method, we recommend getting in touch with a Fertility Awareness Educator.

I'm having trouble figuring out my cervical fluid pattern.

Your personal cervical fluid pattern might take some time to figure out at first, but trust us when we say this knowledge is completely worth it! If you find yourself stuck, there's tons of great information on our website. If you still find yourself struggling, get in touch with an amazing Fertility Awareness Educator to help you chart with confidence!

Why can't I add a passcode to Groove's app?

We think that protecting your cycle data is just as important as protecting your emails, text messages, and other sensitive personal information on your device. It’s simple to add a passcode to your iPhone or iPad, and we think it’s super important to add features to Groove that aren’t already provided by your device. This allows us to focus on features that will help make Groove the best app available.

Why doesn’t Groove support Celsius temperatures?

We initially released the Groove app only within the United States. If you are outside of the U.S. or simply prefer charting in Celsius, we’re getting there. We’ll have you Groovin’ in no time!

Why doesn’t Groove have notes or a daily journal?

The ability to add daily notes is a very popular feature request, so we’re adding it real soon! We’re all about making our Groovers happy.
